summary: 1. make heavy armor more useful, 2. mix & match of heavy and light armor, and 3. equipments added by mods.
descriptionHtml:
Sorry for my poor Engligh first.

**Upload a patch for [Weapons and Armor Fixes - Remade with Dawnguard and Dragonborn support]**

**v2_1 version is uploaded**

=The reason for making this mod=
(1) make heavy armor more useful
In vanilla game, we can easilly reach the armor cap with light armor, so heavy armor isn't as useful as it should be.( See the Armor Cap section of this page: http://www.uesp.net/wiki/Skyrim:Armor )

(2) mix & match of heavy and light armor
In vanilla game, most perks of heavy armor and light armor require a full set of heavy or light armor (including cuirass, boots, helmet and gauntlets) to bring into effect, and this make mix & match of heavy and light armor is nearly impossible.

(3) equipments added by mods.
In vanilla game, those perks not only ask a full set armor, but also ask us not to wear both heavy and light armor. It is ok in vanilla game, because there are not other equipments which can be equipped with a full armor set (4 pieces, cuirass, boots, helmet and gauntlets). But some mods add new equipments that are not cuirass, boots, helmet or gauntlets, so we can equip them with a full armor set. If we wear a full heavy armor set (cuirass, boots, helmet and gauntlets), and equip a equipment added by a mod which have the key word "armorlight" (means it belongs to light armor) , it will cause those perks not working.



============================================================================================
v2_1 version

=What's new=
(1) Require skyrim 1.9.32.0.8

(2) Fix the issue that the two Matching Set perks (both Heavy Armor and Light Armor) do not work correctly on some sets in v2 version. It is my mistake that I made v2 without using the update.esm. v2_1 version is remade based on update.esm, so 1.9.32.0.8 is required.

(3) Chang the descrption of the Matching Set(Heavy Armor) and Art Of Heavy.
(The discription in v2 version is too long to display in game.)
(Effects are the same as v2 version.)
( ........ Without Conditioning, the more pieces of heavy armor being worn, the more ranged(Art Of Heavy) /melee(Matching Set) weapon damage being reduced. )

(4) If you have used v2 version, just uninstall it then install v2_1

(5) Sorry for making such a big mistake.



============================================================================================
v2 version

=How I change vanilla perks=
I do these by couting the number of how much heavy or light armor being worn.

=The differences in v2 version (compared with v1)=
(1) Thre are not new perks anymore.
All the effects of new perks added in v1 are integrated into vanilla perks.
Player need not pay additional perk points to get those effects.
(2) Perk trees are not modded.
Now it is campatible with mods adding new perks and modding perk trees.

=List of vanilla perks being modded=
<<Heavy armor>>
(1) [Well Fitted]
When wearing heavy armor without light armor, 25% Heavy Armor bonus if wearing at least 3 pieces of heavy armor; when with light armor, 25% bonus if wearing at least 2 pieces.
(Only heavy armor rating will be raised.)

(2) [Tower of Strength]
50% less stagger if wearing more than 4 pieces of heavy armor. When wearing less than 3 pieces, 10% less for each piece being worn.

(3) [Matching Set]
Additional 25% Armor bonus if wearing a matched set of Heavy Armor. Without the Conditioning perk, 25% less damage from melee weapons if wearing more than 4 pieces of heavy armor; when wearing less than 3 pieces, 5% less for each piece being worn.
(Vanilla effect of this perk is not affected by owning the Conditioning, only less damage effec is affected.)

(4) [Fists Of Steel] renamed to [Art Of Heavy]
Unarmed attacks with Heavy Armor gauntlets do their armor rating in extra damage. Without the Conditioning perk, 50% less damage from ranged weapons if wearing more than 4 pieces of heavy armor; when wearing less than 3 pieces, 10% less for each piece being worn.
(Vanilla effect of this perk is not affected by owning the Conditioning, only less damage effec is affected.)

(5) [Cushioned]
50% less damage from falling if wearing more than 4 pieces of heavy armor. When wearing less than 3 pieces, 10% less for each piece being worn.

(6) [Reflect Blows]
10% chance to reflect melee damage back to the enemy while wearing more than 4 pieces of heavy armor.

----------------------
<<Light Armor>>

(1) [Custom Fit]
When wearing light armor without heavy armor, 25% Light Armor bonus if wearing at least 3 pieces of light armor; when with heavy armor, 25% bonus if wearing at least 2 pieces.
(Only light armor rating will be raised.)


(2) [Wind Walker]
Stamina regenerates 50% faster if not wearing any heavy armor, 25% faster if wearing less than 2 pieces of heavy armor.

(3) [Deft Movement]
10% chance of avoiding all physical damage while not wearing any heavy armor.

=Compatibility=
It is compatible with any mod just adding new perks and modding perk trees.
It is not compatible with any mod changing perks modded by this mod.



============================================================================================
v1 version

=Description=
Change some old perks and add some new perks

=How I change old perks and add new perks=
I do these by couting the number of how much heavy or light armor be worn.

=Vanilla perks and new perks=
<<Heavy Armor>>
(1) [Well Fitted] {vanilla perk}
(from)
25% Armor bonus if wearing all Heavy Armor: head, chest, hands, feet.
(to)
When wearing heavy armor without light armor, 25% Armor bonus if wearing at least 3 pieces of heavy armor.

(2) [Mix Match Heavy] {new perk}
When wearing heavy armor with light armor, 20% Armor bonus if wearing at least 2 pieces of heavy armor.
(need the Well Fitted perk)

(3) [Tower of Strength] {vanilla perk}
(from)
50% less stagger when wearing only Heavy Armor.
(to)
50% less stagger if wearing at least 4 pieces of heavy armor.

(4) [Pillar of Strength] {new perk}
When wearing less than 3 pieces of heavy armor, 10% less stagger for each piece.
(need the Tower of Strength perk)

(5) [Cushioned] {vanilla perk}
(from)
Half damage from falling if wearing all Heavy Armor: head, chest, hands, feet.
(to)
Half damage from falling if wearing at least 4 pieces of heavy armor.

(6) [Matted] {new perk}
When wearing less than 3 pieces of heavy armor, 10% less damage from falling for each piece.
(need the Cushioned perk)

(7) [Reflect Blows] {vanilla perk}
(from)
10% chance to reflect melee damage back to the enemy while wearing all Heavy Armor: head, chest, hands, feet.
(to)
10% chance to reflect melee damage back to the enemy while wearing at least 4 pieces of heavy armor.

(8) [Defense Arrow] {new perk}
10% less damage from ranged weapons for each piece of heavy armor you wear, max 40% for 4 pieces or above.
(need the Fists of Steel perk)

(9) [Full Armor] {new perk}
5% less damage from melee weapons for each piece of heavy armor you wear, max 20% for 4 pieces or above. Can't be obtained with Conditioning.
(need the Cushioned perk)

(10) [Conditioning] {vanilla perk}
(from)
Heavy Armor weighs nothing and doesn't slow you down when worn.
(to)
Heavy Armor weighs nothing and doesn't slow you down when worn. Can't be obtained with Full Armor.

<<Light Armor>>
(1) [Custom Fit] {vanilla perk}
(from)
25% Armor bonus if wearing all Light Armor: head, chest, hands, feet.
(to)
When wearing light armor without heavy armor, 25% Armor bonus if wearing at least 3 pieces of light armor.

(2) [Mix Match Light] {new perk}
When wearing light armor with heavy armor, 20% Armor bonus if wearing at least 2 pieces of light armor.
(need the Custom Fit perk)

(3) [Wind Walker] {vanilla perk}
(from)
Stamina regenerates 50% faster in all Light Armor: head, chest, hands, feet.
(to)
Stamina regenerates 50% faster if not wearing any heavy armor.

(4) [Breeze Walker] {new perk}
When wearing any heavy armor, stamina regenerates 25% faster if wearing less than 2 pieces of heavy armor.
(need the Wind Walker perk)

(5) [Deft Movement] {vanilla perk}
(from)
10% chance of avoiding all damage from a melee attack while wearing all Light Armor: head, chest, hands, feet.
(to)
10% chance of avoiding all damage from a melee attack while not wearing any heavy armor.

=Required=
skyrim 1.9.32.0.8

=compatibility=
Any mod that doesn't change Heavy Armor and Light Armor perk trees and related perks.



============================================================================================
=Other mods I play with this mod=
Increased Armor Cap
Enemy AI OverHaul---Revenge Of the Enemies---No Scripts Version
TK Dodge
Ultimate Combat
Deadly Dragons
Dragon Combat Overhaul



============================================================================================
I really like the mod "Requiem" and its armor system, and I play it for a long time.
But when i begin to play without it, i find that I can't bear the vanilla heavy armor system.
So I make this mod for my personal use.
If you are looking for a mod that changes armor perks, see if this useful.
